title: Andersonville National Historic Site: Witnesses Who Testified at the Wirz Trial
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture     Stories     The Trial of Henry Wirz     Witnesses Who Testified at the Wirz Trial                  Witnesses Who Testified at the Trial of Henry Wirz         The Trial of Henry Wirz Harper's Weekly  At the end of the Civil War, Captain Henry Wirz was arrested and prosecuted for his involvment at Andersonville. He was the most famous of the nearly 1,000 individuals to be prosecuted for violating the laws of war. During his trial, more than 140 guards, Confederate officials, prisoners, civilians, and Federal officials testified about Wirz's management of the prison.
